world.bentobox.bentobox.database

Class AbstractDatabaseHandler<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.bentobox.bentobox.database.AbstractDatabaseHandler<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractJSONDatabaseHandler, TransitionDatabaseHandler, YamlDatabaseHandler

    public abstract class AbstractDatabaseHandler<T>
extends Object
    An abstract class that handles insert/select-operations into/from a database
    Author:
    tastybento

    • Field Detail

      • processQueue

        protected Queue<Runnable> processQueue
        FIFO queue for saves or deletions. Note that the assumption here is that most database objects will be held in memory because loading is not handled with this queue. That means that it is theoretically possible to load something before it has been saved. So, in general, load your objects and then save them async only when you do not need the data again immediately.

      • asyncSaveTask

      • deleteObject

        public abstract void deleteObject(T instance)
                           throws IllegalAccessException,
                                  InvocationTargetException,
                                  IntrospectionException
        Deletes the object with the unique id from the database. If the object does not exist, it will fail silently. Use objectExists(String) if you need to know if the object is in the database beforehand.
        Parameters:
        instance - - object instance
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException
        InvocationTargetException
        IntrospectionException

        public abstract void deleteID(String uniqueId)

        Parameters:

        Since:
        1.1
